website_summaries.verdict: Vintage-looking tabletop radio with multiple technology perks.
pros: Dial changes color to alert you to when radio station is properly tuned
SD card slot and USB port, which doubles as a device-charging port
Bluetooth enabled to work with smartphones, tablets, computers
cons: Low volume, but hooks up to auxiliary speakers

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product at all
customer_reviews.text: The radio has a very annoying hum when in Bluetooth mode which in and of itself is reason enough to return this product. Additionally, there is a very bright blue light that flashes on the side when in Bluetooth mode so forget trying to use this radio in a darkened room unless you cover that light. Also, when using Bluetooth the radio dial light is not on at all so there is no visual indication that the radio is even on. When in AM/FM mode the dial light is blue when it is on instead of it being white or more yellow as it would be on a truly retro radio. This is not a well designed product.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Excellent radio for those not seeking concert hall sound quality
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my wife. She loves it. Everything on it works well, and we haven't had any problems with it. It matches the retro decor in the kitchen. The one comment I kept seeing was about the sound quality. I agree that it's not concert hall quality, but I think that's by design. The tone quality is similar to the tone quality on a genuine 30's radio. It has that 'nostalgic' sound. Obviously it sounds much better than a true 30's radio, but my wife and I feel the tone qualities give it more ambiance. Overall, we're very happy with the radio, and would definitely recommend it to someone looking for a retro looking radio.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kraffert

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking and has a charger and Bluetooth but when it comes to the sound is just bad. When set on Bluetooth it's sound a little better but nothing like it should sound for the price of the unit the speakers are small weak and not clear at all .
customer_reviews.author: kevin p lynch

customer_reviews.title: Dial doesn't light up when in Bluetooth mode
customer_reviews.text: The lighted dial ONLY lights up in AM/FM radio mode. This is not specified in the product description. You will be very disappointed if you get this and intend to use it in Bluetooth or USB mode and expect the lighted dial to be lit, because it won't be. It does have a nice appearance and feels substantial and not flimsy, but they need to make it so the lighted dial stays on no matter what mode you are in. Back it goes :(
customer_reviews.author: TwistedTwizzlers

customer_reviews.title: It will not last long
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a birthday present for my wife's office. It worked for about a month. Then nothing worked. We called the supplier and they asked us to pay for the shipping for them to look at it. It stopped 1 day past the Amazon return date. I recommend you buy from someone else. Poor Quality and no concern from supplier when it stops working.
customer_reviews.author: keith s

customer_reviews.title: looks and sounds nice
customer_reviews.text: I have a very old fashioned looking bedroom with vintage linens and a bedroom set from the 1920s. I wanted a radio to listen to at night, and I wanted it to fit the rest of the decor. I researched many radios and this one had the look and the features I wanted, at a nice price. The sound is nice for the price point, and the reception is good. The dials and knobs are easy to see. I love having bluetooth with an old fashioned looking radio. I'm very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: 1930s Meets 2017 (With New Technology and Better Sound)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my husband who like retro looking things. Our stereo has been busted for awhile (and we are limited in space to put things) so we settled on this for our living room. The sound quality is AMAZING. We generally play music off the TF/SD card (you'll need an adapter for your microSD) and it's fine. We still laugh at the foreign-ish sounding accent that announces "play by SD card". No, you can't disable it. You can use a USB drive to play music. The AM/FM radio sounds great, too. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: M. A. Perez

customer_reviews.title: looks real good terrible tuner
customer_reviews.text: while the case looks good the tuner is terrible. hard to see and doesn't line up with the frequency your trying to adjust for. very poor reception even dead center on your channel.
customer_reviews.author: Sidney Williams

customer_reviews.title: Nice radio - great look - rich sound
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking easy to use. The AM channel works terribly in my house, but that is most likely my house and not the radios fault. The FM channel is perfect and the bluetooth is great. I love how it looks on the counter of my 50's kitchen. The sound is deep and rich. It is a bit more expensive than the others I was looking at, but it is a perfect size and design.
customer_reviews.author: Dorian

customer_reviews.title: Love my radio.
customer_reviews.text: I love my vintage radio and listen to NPR almost every evening. The sound is great. I haven't set up the bluetooth because I'm just not that technologically inclined but I am so glad I purchased this handsome, little radio. I fully expect to hear Franklin D. Roosevelt to come over the radio at any minute!
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Shields

customer_reviews.title: Cannot hold station and very susceptible to interference
customer_reviews.text: I don’t recommend this radio. These are the two problems with it: 1. It does not tune and hold stations. It take a long if time sometimes to tune and eventually it starts to drift and tune to neighboring stations 2. It is extremely susceptible to interference. I cannot use it at the same time with my massager because it won’t tune stations I have this radio for a long time now and wish I had taken the time to write this review sooner.
customer_reviews.author: book worm 834

customer_reviews.title: Great little radio
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little radio. I would have given it a 5* rating except for the audio output on back. The sound is extremely low if using headphones or ear buds. RCA plugs are okay but 1/8" plug would be better. I purchased an amplifier (YOHOOLYO Portable Headphone Amplifier Audio Powered Headphone Amplifier) to boost the sound to my earbuds. USB works well as does the SD slot and the FM radio. You will need an adapter - RCA to 1/8" mini plug for ear buds.
customer_reviews.author: Marineguy

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THE VINTAGE!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! Talk about vintage meets future! I bought this for the vintage/retro vibe, as my home is all vintage. My hubs loves it because he can just plug in his nano & rock out to his tunes while reading the paper or just vegging out (yes, we're old that way). win-win!!
customer_reviews.author: Granny Piper

customer_reviews.title: Great Vintage Design
customer_reviews.text: I love the vintage design!! It is what caught my eye. The light when you turn it on is the best part. I would have given this product five stars but the speaker sound is a bit weak. It serves it's purpose which was to have in my bedroom so I can listen to the radio while getting ready in the morning. This is not a boom box for you to show off your music selection.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: GREAT-use the RCA jacks!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. It has RCA jacks on the back, hooked up my $30 computer speakers with volume control and it sounds GREAT. Just turn the sound on the radio down all the way and run the sound through the computer speakers. Perfect, that's why I bought this radio, because it has the RCA jack on the back. If you get this definitely get speakers with volume control on them, you will not regret it. Blue tooth works great, radio has great reception, I live way out in the country, no problem getting stations. Highly recommend this, it looks AWSOME, really looks like an antique and with auxiliary speakers sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Great radio for the money and yes...its loud enough
customer_reviews.text: Ok...I'm seeing people say it's not loud enough. Guys it's a 60 to 70 dollar radio. It's not a boom box or concert hall stereo. I've had zero issues. The display is bright and attractive. The sound is loud for its size. I can hear it across the house and our home is rather large. It's a good radio for the price. Control your expectations with your budget.
customer_reviews.author: JTerry

customer_reviews.title: Could be better - But it's BEAUTIFUL!
customer_reviews.text: Why only 4 stars? This radio's sound quality should be better quality than it is, and it really should be a wifi radio for the price. It can't communicate wirelessly with my laptop but can with my cellphone, though it drains it unless I plug it into the USB port. BUT: It is BEAUTIFUL in my house that's full of antiques, and the dial lighting up in such pretty colors takes me back to my grandparents' old Philco and Zenith radios from... Well, several decades ago. And, too, you can always hook up an aux sound source to boost the sound quality. But disguise that speaker somewhere behind an antique table!

customer_reviews.title: Great look, poor sound!
customer_reviews.text: Great looking retro radio but poor audio output for the price of it. I expected better sound, but the wife loves it in her vintage camper so will keep it. Otherwise I would return it. Have not tried an SD card or the the USB port yet but the bluetooth feature functions well.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift
